title: Has the ACA been examined by a legal authority? - Quora

response.answer_text: Has the ACA been examined by a legal authority? At this point - with the multiple lawsuits and cases against it, as well as SCOYUS rulings against aspects of it - I suspect we are pretty much at a yes Not by A as in single complete - but as in different parts by several different lawyers and judges. Now as the different cases wind through courts, we will see just how much remains after the different rulings We already had one case this year, where the findings were for the plaintiff and against Congress

During its creation, hundreds of legal authorities examined it in detail, scrutinizing the minutia to make sure it satisfied all legal requirements before sending it to Congress for ratification. Afterwards, another slew of folks with legal backgrounds at all levels weighed in about various parts of it.

Yes, many times, by many lawyers. Depending upon who you would define as a 'legal authority' may change the answer to No. A parking ticket is issued by a legal authority. The American Bar Association is a legal authority. A Park Ranger is a legal authority. I could come up with thousands of legal authorities, including the Justices on the Supreme Court.

Congress passed it, President Obama signed it, Supreme Court voted to uphold the act. No legal authority matters at this point. However, there are challenges to the ACA working through the court system.
